intro: Biscutella variegata, commonly known as the variegated biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a distinctive variegated pattern of green and white. Biscutella variegata is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
